text: Charles Moss "Charlie" Duke Jr. (born October 3, 1935), (Brig Gen, USAF, Ret.), is an American former astronaut, retired U.S. Air Force officer and test pilot. As Lunar Module Pilot for Apollo 16 in 1972, at the age of 36, he became the tenth and youngest person to walk on the Moon. Duke is the last surviving crew member of Apollo 16. A former test pilot, Duke has logged 4,147 hours flying time, which includes 3,632 hours in jet aircraft and 265 hours in space, plus 20 hours and 15 minutes of extravehicular activity. ==References== ==Other websites== * * Category:1935 births Category:Living people Category:Apollo astronauts Category:American aviators Category:Military people from North Carolina Category:Scientists from North Carolina Category:People from Charlotte, North Carolina
title: Charles Duke
